metadata.title: 23-F DECLASSIFIED
metadata.description: Declassified documents from the attempted coup d'état of February 23, 1981 in Spain

ch1.title: The Context
ch1.description: Spain between the Transition and the abyss: political crisis, terrorism, and the rattle of sabers

ch2.title: The Conspirators
ch2.description: Tejero, Milans del Bosch, Armada and the network that wove the coup

ch3.title: 18:23 — Assault on Congress
ch3.description: The 200 seconds that paralyzed Spain: the storming of the chamber

ch4.title: The Night of the Transistors
ch4.description: Tanks in Valencia, Spain glued to the radio, and the King's message

ch5.title: The Trial
ch5.description: The court-martial, the sentences, and the unanswered questions

ch6.title: State Secrets
ch6.description: Classified documents, CESID reports, and the shadows that persist

ch7.title: Legacy and Memory
ch7.description: 23-F in Spanish democracy: lessons, myths, and truth

footer.sources: Sources: Council of Ministers, General Archive of the Administration, Congress of Deputies, Pablo Iglesias Foundation, national newspaper archives
footer.legal: Original documents are property of the Spanish State. This project is for educational and informational purposes only.

about.title: About this project
about.subtitle: Context, methodology, and sources behind 23-F Declassified

documents.title: About these documents
documents.p1: On February 25, 2025, the Spanish Council of Ministers approved the declassification of documents related to the attempted coup d'etat of February 23, 1981.
documents.p2: A total of 154 documents from four ministries — Defense, Interior, Foreign Affairs, and the BOE — were declassified after being classified as "Secret" and "Reserved" for 44 years.
documents.p3: This declassification represents the largest single batch of coup-related documents ever declassified in Spanish history.

order.title: The Declassification Order
order.p1: A Royal Decree approved by the Council of Ministers ordered the declassification of the documents.
order.p2: The order was published in the Boletin Oficial del Estado (BOE) and covers documents from CESID/CNI, the Ministry of Defense, the Ministry of the Interior, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
order.p3: The full text of the BOE publication is contained in Doc_1_boe.txt, the first document in this archive.
order.quote: The declassification of classified documents and information related to the attempted coup d'etat of February 23, 1981 is hereby agreed.
order.quoteSource: Doc_1_boe.txt — Boletin Oficial del Estado, February 25, 2025
order.quoteContext: Council of Ministers agreement to declassify 23-F documents

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.p1: Original PDFs were obtained from government archives following the publication of the declassification order.

steps.title: Processing pipeline:
steps.s1: OCR processing with Python (pytesseract) for text extraction
steps.s4: Synthesized into thematic chapters with full document attribution

sources.title: Sources
sources.s2: Archivo General de la Administracion (General Archive of the Administration)
sources.b1: Santos Julia — Historian of the Spanish Transition
sources.b2: Javier Cercas — "Anatomy of an Instant" (Anatomia de un instante, 2009)
sources.b3: Paul Preston — Historian of contemporary Spain
sources.b4: Charles Powell — Specialist in the Transition and the monarchy

legal.title: Legal Notice
legal.p1: Original documents are the property of the Spanish State.
legal.p2: This website is a journalistic and educational project. No classified information has been accessed outside the scope of the declassification order.
legal.p3: Document excerpts are used for research and public interest purposes under Spanish intellectual property law and the right to information.

credits.title: Credits
